intro: Pterospermum celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes pterospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian islands of Sulawesi and Bali. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and deciduous leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
